meanings.definition: A sudden burst of energy or emotion.
meanings.sent1: After hearing the exciting news, a spirt of joy filled her heart.
meanings.sent2: The crowd erupted with a spirt of enthusiasm when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: His spirt of determination helped him overcome the obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent4: The spirt of kindness in her actions touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The spirt of adventure led them to explore new places together.

meanings.definition: To flow or gush out in a rapid stream.
meanings.sent1: Water began to spirt out of the broken pipe, creating a mess.
meanings.sent2: The fountain spirted water high into the air, delighting onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The juice spirted out of the squeezed orange and landed on the table.
meanings.sent4: Emotions spirted out of her as she shared her deepest thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The volcano spirted lava, painting the sky with fiery colors.

meanings.sent1: She poured a spirt of milk into her coffee.
meanings.sent2: A spirt of rain hit the window, signaling the start of a storm.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a spirt of lemon juice to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: A spirt of oil accidentally spilled on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent5: He felt a spirt of water on his face as he walked under the leaking roof.
